intro: Centaurea boissieri subsp. integrifolia, commonly known as the Armenian star-thistle, is a perennial herb native to the mountains of Armenia and Turkey. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower heads, which are surrounded by sharp, spiny bracts. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting a variety of pollinators. This subspecies is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils.
